repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: could be part of `parse_float_config` , so it also works in nvim_open_win
Is it allowed to set hide in nvim_open_win :thinking:  If set, will any errors pop up?
Yes and yes. It is the same as calling set_config right after open_win, and it has no effect on errors

This error should still be removed. As I said, this would be trivial to emulate using a second `nvim_win_set_config` without an intermediate redraw, so forbidding this just obscures what really is going on.
`ui_comp_remove_grid()` is safe to call even if grid wasn't present. Therefore I don't think we need this check, and thus `w_float_flags` field doesn't need to be added at all.

Hmm, what is an external UI expected to do with such a float position when `hide=true` ? I'd just use `ui_call_win_hide()` which UI:s already need to handle when a float is hidden due to being on a different tabpage.
I'd add `meths.win_set_config(win, {hide = true})` and add yet an expect, so show it can be hidden properly after already displayed.

comment_regular_data.body: It's strange that this PR was inspired by https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/16747 but we didn't use `visible` as the flag name (which is more common and intuitive). Why?
vim have `popup_hide` to hide a float window so there use hide too

> vim have `popup_hide` to hide a float window

it sets `visible=false` in that case, right?

ah yeah vim popups use the "hidden" flag https://github.com/vim/vim/blob/66f65a46c5d169f20f780721d4f74d4729855b96/runtime/doc/popup.txt#L733

which aligns with the buffer 'hidden' option. that's not quite the same as "hide".

and pum_visible: https://github.com/vim/vim/blob/66f65a46c5d169f20f780721d4f74d4729855b96/runtime/doc/builtin.txt#L1854

and `pumvisible()`: https://github.com/vim/vim/blob/66f65a46c5d169f20f780721d4f74d4729855b96/runtime/doc/builtin.txt#L466
Pumvisible Popupvisible is used to describe visibility rather than actions. Hide is an action.

> Hide is an action.

it is a field (state) on the win config. and we are checking that state in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/30507 ...

title: feat(float): support toggle show float window
